results.title: Counteracting Chemoresistance with Metformin in Breast Cancers: Targeting Cancer Stem Cells
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ selectively targets CSCs and improves the @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic@@@ microenvironment, suppresses the @DISEASE_Neoplasm_Metastasis @DISEASE_MESH:D009362 @@@tumor metastasis@@@ and @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@, as well as regulates the metabolic programming, induces apoptosis, and reverses epithelial-mesenchymal transition and @DISEASE_Tuberculosis_Multidrug_Resistant @DISEASE_MESH:D018088 @@@MDR@@@.

citations.NLM: Samuel SM, Varghese E, Koklesová L, Líšková A, Kubatka P, Büsselberg D. Counteracting Chemoresistance with Metformin in Breast Cancers: Targeting Cancer Stem Cells Cancers (Basel). 2020 Sep 1;12(9):. PMID: 32883003

results.title: Safety and feasibility trial protocol of metformin in infants after perinatal brain injury.
results.text_hl: Herein, we describe a clinical trial of the safety, feasibility and pharmacokinetics of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in infants with @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@HIE@@@.

results.title: The Chemosensitizing Role of Metformin in Anti-Cancer Therapy.
results.text_hl: A growing body of evidence indicates that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ can sensitize @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumor@@@ responses to different chemotherapeutic drugs, such as hormone modulating drugs, anti-metabolite drugs, antibiotics, and DNA-damaging drugs via selective targeting of @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@Cancer@@@ Stem Cells (CSCs), improving the @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic@@@ microenvironment, and by suppressing @DISEASE_Neoplasm_Metastasis @DISEASE_MESH:D009362 @@@tumor metastasis@@@ and @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@.

citations.NLM: Tang Z, Tang N, Jiang S, Bai Y, Guan C, Zhang W, Fan S, Huang Y, Lin H, Ying Y. The Chemosensitizing Role of Metformin in Anti-Cancer Therapy. Anticancer Agents Med Chem. 2021;21(8):949-962. PMID: 32951587

results.title: Metformin as a Modulator of Autophagy and Hypoxia Responses in the Enhancement of Wound Healing in Diabetic Rats.
results.text_hl: Herein, we investigated the role of topical @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, an established anti-@DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ drug with potential autophagy-inducing properties, in improving wound healing outcomes under @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic@@@ conditions.

results.title: Effects of plateau hypoxia on population pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of metformin in patients with Type 2 diabetes.
results.journal: Zhong Nan Da Xue Xue Bao Yi Xue Ban
results.text_hl: ...OBJECTIVES: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ is the basic drug for treating @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@, and the plateau @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic@@@ environment is an important factor affecting the pharmacokinetics of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, but there have been no reports of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ pharmacokinetic parameters in patients with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@diabetes mellitus type 2@@@ (@DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2DM@@@) in the high-altitude @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic@@@ environment.
